intro: Zieria obcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf zieria, is a small shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or greyish hairs. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in spring. Zieria obcordata is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
